SEARCH
Module com.example.umlscd
Package com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram

Class ClassEditorManager

java.lang.Object
com.example.umlscd.BusinessLayer.ClassDiagram.ClassEditorManager
public class ClassEditorManager extends Object

Class Editor Manager

The ClassEditorManager class is responsible for managing the logic related to class editing in the UML Class Diagram Editor. It interacts with the ClassDiagramManager to update the class diagram model with changes to the class name, attributes, and methods.

This class provides functionality for adding custom data types, managing method parameters, and applying changes from the editor UI to the UML model.

Authors: Ahmad Wyne, Wahaj Asif, Muhammad Muneeb

Version: 1.0

Since: 2024-12-03

  • Field Details

    • parameters

      public List<String> parameters
      Temporary storage for method parameters.

      This list holds parameters being added to a method before the method is finalized and added to the UML model.

    • classDiagramManager

      public ClassDiagramManager classDiagramManager
      Reference to the ClassDiagramManager.

      The ClassDiagramManager is responsible for managing the overall class diagram, including adding, updating, and removing classes, interfaces, and relationships. This reference allows the ClassEditorManager to interact with the class diagram for model updates.

  • Constructor Details

    • ClassEditorManager

      public ClassEditorManager()
      Default constructor.

      Initializes the ClassEditorManager. No specific initialization is required for this class, but this constructor ensures proper object creation.

  • Method Details

    • setClassDiagramManager

      public void setClassDiagramManager(ClassDiagramManager manager)
      Sets the reference to the ClassDiagramManager instance.

      This method allows the ClassEditorManager to interact with the ClassDiagramManager, enabling updates to the UML model and class diagram.

      Parameters:
      manager - The ClassDiagramManager instance to be set.

    • setClassBox

      public void setClassBox(javafx.scene.layout.VBox classBox, UMLClassBox umlClassBox)
      Sets the class box and UML class box references.

      This method sets the references for the class box UI component and the associated UMLClassBox model. It ensures that the editor can interact with the correct class and its corresponding box in the diagram.

      Parameters:
      classBox - The VBox representing the class box in the UI.
      umlClassBox - The UMLClassBox representing the class model.

    • getClassName

      public String getClassName()
      Retrieves the name of the class from the UI.

      This method extracts the class name from the class box UI. It assumes that the class name is displayed in the first label of the class box.

      Returns:
      The name of the class.

    • getAttributes

      public String getAttributes()
      Retrieves the attributes of the class from the UI.

      This method extracts the class attributes from the class box UI and returns them as a formatted string, with each attribute on a new line.

      Returns:
      The attributes of the class as a string.

    • getMethods

      public String getMethods()
      Retrieves the methods of the class from the UI.

      This method extracts the methods of the class from the class box UI and returns them as a formatted string, with each method on a new line.

      Returns:
      The methods of the class as a string.

    • applyChanges

      public void applyChanges(String className, String attributesText, String methodsText)
      Applies the changes made in the editor to the model and updates relationships in the diagram.

      This method takes the updated class name, attributes, and methods from the editor and applies them to the corresponding UMLClassBox and ClassDiagramManager. It also ensures that the relationships involving the renamed class are updated accordingly.

      Parameters:
      className - The new class name.
      attributesText - The updated attributes text.
      methodsText - The updated methods text.

    • handleCustomDataType

      public void handleCustomDataType(javafx.scene.control.ComboBox<String> dropdown)
      Handles the addition of a custom data type to a dropdown list.

      This method displays a dialog to the user, prompting for a custom data type. If a valid custom type is entered, it is added to the provided dropdown list, allowing the user to select it as a data type option.

      Parameters:
      dropdown - The ComboBox<String> where the custom data type will be added.

    • addParameterToMethod

      public void addParameterToMethod(String parameter)
      Adds a parameter to the temporary list of parameters for the current method.

      This method allows the user to add method parameters one by one. The parameters are temporarily stored in a list until the method signature is finalized and added to the UML model.

      Parameters:
      parameter - The parameter to be added.

    • finalizeMethod

      public String finalizeMethod(String methodName, String returnType, String visibility)
      Finalizes the method signature with parameters.

      This method constructs the complete method signature by combining the method name, parameters, return type, and visibility. It formats the signature in the standard UML method notation.

      Parameters:
      methodName - The name of the method.
      returnType - The return type of the method.
      visibility - The visibility modifier of the method (e.g., +, -, #).
      Returns:
      A String representing the finalized method signature.

    • resetParameters

      public void resetParameters()
      Resets the temporary list of parameters after adding the method.

      This method clears the list of parameters, ensuring that previous parameters do not carry over to new methods.
